description: Paris, Berlin and London failed to sway Tehran, which demands a ceasefire as a precondition for talks. They also faced criticism from Donald Trump, who said 'Europe is not going to be able to help in this one.'

Five years later, the 'hangover' of the French citizens who took part in the Convention for the Climate
description: On June 21, 2020, 150 randomly selected citizens submitted 149 proposals to the government. Since then, some have shifted careers to work on environmental issues, while others have moved on.

headline: Russia and Ukraine swap more prisoners after Istanbul talks
description: Russia and Ukraine exchanged captured soldiers on Friday in the latest prisoner swap agreed during peace talks in Istanbul, offering a rare sign of cooperation despite stalled negotiations and continued fighting.

headline: Polo at high altitude in Pakistan, with no rules or referee
description: Every year during the Shandur Festival, rival teams from Chitral and Gilgit-Baltistan face off in a match that often leaves both men and horses seriously injured.

headline: A captivating investigation into a compromising photo of a president
description: In his new book 'La Photo,' the journalist Patrice Duhamel revisits the long-concealed picture of a young François Mitterrand meeting with Philippe Pétain during the war.

description: The entire country is expected to experience the 50th heatwave since records began in 1947, according to the national weather agency, which placed 27 departments on yellow heat alert starting Thursday noon.

headline: Chinese cities are facing the financial abyss of their subway systems
description: After high-speed rail, subway lines are now dragging the cities they serve into huge levels of debt. This is due to colossal construction and operating costs, minimal revenues and a toxic relationship with real estate developers.

headline: How close is Iran to having nuclear weapons?
description: Israel has bombed strategic sites in Iran, which it said could soon produce a nuclear weapon. Tehran had announced it was increasing its production of enriched uranium, amid stalled talks with the United States.
